text:
Hello everyone,

I offer support in Salesforce Marketing Cloud and specialize in handling long-term projects. With 2 years of hands-on experience, I'm proficient in Ampscript, SSJS, Email Studio, Automation Studio, Journey Builder, Marketing Cloud APIs, and more.

If you're in need of assistance, feel free to reach out. Let's discuss how I can support your project further.

Best regards,
Ahmed
Is there any way to determine if the SSL has been provisioned before cutting the CMS DNS records from another provider to the HubSpot IP addresses?

Hi! I am building a customized landing page for a client that they are going to send via email to their customers.

I am able to print the contact information such as Name, address, etc on the landing page by adding the email parameter to the url, for example:

<http://example.com?email=john.doe@gmail.com|example.com?email=john.doe@gmail.com>

This way HubSpot CMS recognizes the email parameter and I can print on the page contact properties such as {{contact.first_name}} to print "John" in it.

Lovely feature to generate customized landing pages! <3

The only issue I have is that our client is a little concerned about privacy and he wants another mechanism so people can't look for the personal information of other emails.

Is there a way to use another identifier in the URL to detect the contact? Hashing the email address? Or something?
my HubSpot menu isn’t showing up in safari :scream:
Same
Thought it was just me

You may also be able to skip passing in the email parameter to the URL, assuming you’re sending these emails via HubSpot. Have you tried seeing if cookies and email links are enough to ID contacts on their own?

If you’re creating pages that might contain any kind of private or sensitive information, you’ll probably want to use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/crm-objects|private, dynamically-generated pages generated from CRM contacts objects>.
<@U7SL518D6> can fix this
some disgruntled intern is just laughing right now
You know the CI/CD tests don't check the nav bar
:joy:
looks like the nav endpoint is down
The team is on it.
:fire:
looks like it's only down for some people though, I tested on a couple other accounts and browsers and it's working on some
`{"status":"error","message":"internal error","correlationId":"87feaf2f-06c9-4ea7-80ba-9038fde47228"}`
it’s probably cloudflare again :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

For Status updates on this issue:
<https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/gk73xp13btj2>

Thanks for the reply, <@U04AQA0QM8E>!

Unfortunately, the emails are going to be sent outside of HubSpot, so we can not cookie the contact to identify it later and since it’s going to be a marketing action, we don’t want to make the users “sign in” into a private page.

Did you face a similar scenario before?

Some of y'all may have noticed a little thank you note from me (if you've been active on here). I disclosed it was automated in the DM, but for those of you I'm pals with - the spirit of the note still very much applies, but want to make sure you know that I know you got one :wink: and that if I could personalize them all, I would. If you reply to it, we'll can have a chat all about you and your hopes and dreams for the dev community!

For those if you that didn't get a little thank you note - if you keep participating in our lovely dev slack, you will eventually! But here's a broad thank you to everyone just or being here! :sparkles:

Hi people.
While trying to retrieve Contacts object data using Get requests my code breaks after retrieving about 10 contact records. I even downloaded the contacts data manually to cross check the 10 records I obtained through my script. Things looks good.

Here is the error message:                                                                                                                                                              An error occurred: Failed to parse: <https://api.hubapi.com><https://api.hubapi.com%7B%27after/|{'after>': '70602', 'link': '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?after=70602>'}

From the above error message, I tried to find the record for 70602 in the manually downloaded contacts (stored in the excel sheet) but it is not there. So, my guess is that for some reason that particular record is corrupted and my API call just breaks.

Has anyone encountered this kind of issue? Any help/direction would be highly appreciated. Thank you

I am now quite certain that the issue is with a specific record (id = 70602). The question is how can I bypass this and continue retrieving other contact records through the API calls. Any insights/help would be really helpful. Thank you.

Hi all, first time posting here  so apologies if this is the wrong place.  Currently facing an issue where there is a global Navbar/footer and I am now needing to add a different navbar for the page I am working on. I have tried cloning the Navigation bar and template file but it has not been working.  Any assistance or pointers in the right direction would be greatly appreciated
